Key Match Events: De'Aaron Fox scored 35 points, including 14 points in the fourth quarter.
The Kings closed the game with a 19-4 run in the final minutes.
Malik Monk contributed 20 points and six assists.
Domantas Sabonis added 17 points, 21 rebounds, and seven assists.
Paul George scored 30 points for the 76ers.
Keon Ellis, starting in place of the injured Keegan Murray, had four steals and two blocks.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim coach Doug Christie praised his team's defensive effort, stating, 'That is the type of fight we expect on a night-to-night basis. Across the board so many guys came up huge. Super proud of them.'
De'Aaron Fox emphasized the importance of winning at home, stating, 'Winning at home always puts you in a good spot.'
